    Bertrand Higy

    I am a postdoctoral researcher at the Centre for Language and Speech Technology at Radboud University.

    • Email

    About

    I am a postdoctoral researcher at the Centre for Language and Speech Technology at Radboud University (the Netherlands).

    My research focuses on computational language learning from speech with a particular emphasis on weakly supervised approaches including visually-grounded learning. I am also interested in interpretability of deep neural networks and computational modeling of lanugage processing/acquisition by humans.

    News

    • 11th November 2021: I will present a poster at the BlackboxNLP workshop about our recent work on the analysis of discrete representations in neural models of speech processing.

    • 15th September 2021: Today, I have officially started my new work as a postdoc in the InDeep project ðŸŽ‰. I will work for 3 years with Louis ten Bosch and Tom Lentz on the interpretability of deep models of speech processing.

    • May 2021: Our new edition of the Zero Resource Speech Challenge, featuring an audio-visual track, has been accepted as a NeurIPS competition.

    • September 2020: Our paper on textual supervision for visually-grounded models of spoken language understanding has been accepted to the Findings of EMNLP 2020!
